1.text: When therefore the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John,

2.text: (Though Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples,)

3.text: He left Judea, and departed again into Galilee.

4.text: And he must needs go through Samaria.

5.text: Then he cometh to a city of Samaria, which is called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground, that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.

6.text: Now Jacobâ€™s well was there. Jesus therefore being wearied with his journey, sat thus on the well: and it was about the sixth hour.

7.text: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water: Jesus saith to her, Give me to drink.

8.text: (For his disciples had gone to the city to buy provisions.)

9.text: Then saith the woman of Samaria to him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, who am a woman of Samaria? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans.

10.text: Jesus answered and said to her, If thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is that saith to thee, Give me to drink; thou wouldst have asked him, and he would have given thee living water.

11.text: The woman saith to him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep: from whence then hast thou that living water?

12.text: Art thou greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank of it himself, and his children, and his cattle?

13.text: Jesus answered and said to her, Whoever drinketh of this water, shall thirst again:

14.text: But whoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him, shall never thirst; but the water that I shall give him, shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life.

15.text: The woman saith to him, Sir, give me this water, that I may not thirst, neither come hither to draw.

16.text: Jesus saith to her, Go, call thy husband, and come hither.

17.text: The woman answered and said, I have no husband. Jesus said to her, Thou hast well said, I have no husband:

18.text: For thou hast had five husbands, and he whom thou now hast, is not thy husband: in that thou hast spoken truth.

19.text: The woman saith to him, Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.

20.text: Our fathers worshiped in this mountain; and ye say, that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.

21.text: Jesus saith to her, Woman, believe me, the hour cometh, when ye shall neither in this mountain, nor yet at Jerusalem, worship the Father.

22.text: Ye worship ye know not what: we know what we worship, for salvation is from the Jews.

23.text: But the hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshipers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth: for the Father seeketh such to worship him.

24.text: God is a Spirit: and they that worship him, must worship him in spirit and in truth.

25.text: The woman saith to him, I know that Messiah cometh, who is called Christ; when he is come, he will tell us all things.

26.text: Jesus saith to her, I that speak to thee am he.

27.text: And upon this came his disciples, and marveled that he talked with the woman: yet no man said, What seekest thou? or, Why talkest thou with her?

28.text: The woman then left her waterpot, and went into the city, and saith to the men,

29.text: Come, see a man who hath told me all things that ever I did: is not this the Christ?

30.text: Then they went out of the city, and came to him.

31.text: In the mean while his disciples prayed him, saying, Master, eat.

32.text: But he said to them, I have food to eat that ye know not of.

33.text: Therefore said the disciples one to another, Hath any man brought him aught to eat?

34.text: Jesus saith to them, My food is to do the will of him that sent me, and to finish his work.

35.text: Say not ye, There are yet four months, and then cometh harvest? behold, I say to you, Lift up your eyes, and look on the fields; for they are white already to harvest.

36.text: And he that reapeth receiveth wages, and gathereth fruit to life eternal: that both he that soweth, and he that reapeth, may rejoice together.

37.text: And herein is that saying true, One soweth, and another reapeth.

38.text: I sent you to reap that on which ye bestowed no labor: other men labored, and ye have entered into their labors.

39.text: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman, who testified, He told me all that ever I did.

40.text: So when the Samaritans had come to him, they besought him that he would tarry with them: and he abode there two days.

41.text: And many more believed, because of his own word;

42.text: And said to the woman, Now we believe, not because of thy saying: for we have heard him ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world.

43.text: Now after two days he departed thence, and went into Galilee.

44.text: For Jesus himself testified that a prophet hath no honor in his own country.

45.text: Then when he had come into Galilee, the Galileans received him, having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast: for they also went to the feast.

46.text: So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum.

47.text: When he heard that Jesus had come from Judea into Galilee, he went to him, and besought him that he would come down, and heal his son: for he was at the point of death.

48.text: Then said Jesus to him, Except ye see signs and wonders, ye will not believe.

49.text: The nobleman saith to him, Sir, come down ere my child dieth.

50.text: Jesus saith to him, Go; thy son liveth. And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken to him, and he departed.

51.text: And as he was now going down, his servants met him, and told him, saying, Thy son liveth.

52.text: Then he inquired of them the hour when he began to amend: and they said to him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.

53.text: So the father knew that it was at the same hour in which Jesus said to him, Thy son liveth: and he himself believed, and his whole house.

54.text: This is again the second miracle that Jesus performed, when he had come from Judea into Galilee.
